issue.title: Install fails with Anaconda Python Distribution

content.raw:
Genomedata expects hdf5 headers in the C_INCLUDE_PATH and the hdf5 libraries in LD_LIBRARY_PATH when installing.

Package managers should set this up correctly for other software to install so I'm not certain in your case whether it's something local to your environment or something specific to Anaconda that's causing the issue. It could very well be that Anaconda is simply try to keep itself self contained as possible (in its own environment) and not necessarily support installing software outside it's own packages.

From looking at your path setup it looks like all the per-requisite software is all bundled together (as in there's no hdf5 directory to only hold the hdf5 software).

I presume a quick fix would be to put /software/anaconda/include on your C_INCLUDE_PATH, the libraries on your LD_LIBRARY_PATH and the hdf5 binaries on your PATH if they're not there already.

e.g.
```shell
export C_INCLUDE_PATH="/software/anaconda/include:${C_INCLUDE_PATH}"
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH="/software/anaconda/lib:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}"
export PATH="/software/anaconda/bin:${PATH}"
```

The good news is you need the headers and the libraries on those paths for the installation. Afterwards they do not (and presumably should not ) need to be set.

If you still have issues please post the full installation logs and your environment settings for your PATH, LD_LIBRARY_PATH, and C_INCLUDE_PATH.
